intro: Centaurea jacea subsp. oxylepis, commonly known as the oxylepis thistle, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features upright, sparsely branched stems that are typically covered in grayish or whitish hairs. The plant produces purple to reddish-blue flower heads, which are surrounded by sharp, spiny bracts. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. This subspecies is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
